alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Scott (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 7:05PM EST until March 04 at 1:25PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Louisville KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Muscatatuck River near Deputy affecting Jefferson and Scott Counties. .Heavy rain from earlier today will cause the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Muscatatuck River near Deputy. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, County roads are underwater. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 23.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 26.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.3 feet on 01/21/1959. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued tomorrow morning.
